statusWord.description:
Status word corresponding to the metered value, defaults to 0.

The status word is a bit mask, where each bit represents a meter status information. If for example the first or least
significant bit is set, a critical error was present in the meter while the value was metered. If the clock of the meter
was invalid and there was a power failure, bits 3 and 4 would be set and the corresponding status word would be
`0b00001100` or `0xC0` or `12`.

The bits are assigned as follows:

[horizontal]
Bit 1:: Critical error e.g. hardware failure or checksum failure
Bit 2:: Clock has been adjusted more than the synchronization limit
Bit 3:: All-phase power failure occurred
Bit 4:: Clock invalid
Bit 5:: Current data set cannot be used

{nbsp}

useProfileProgress.description:
Also use the profile progress to calculate the first profile entry to read. Defaults to: `false`.

The first profile entry to be read will be at max(`from`, `profileProgress`, `now - retentionTime`),
where `from` is specified in this request, `profileProgress` describes the first entry after the last
automatically read profile entry and `retentionTime` describes the time span of meter data preserved on
the meter.

statusWord.description:
Status word corresponding to the metered value, defaults to 0.

The status word is a bit mask, where each bit represents a meter status information. If for example the first or least
significant bit is set, a critical error was present in the meter while the value was metered. If the clock of the meter
was invalid and there was a power failure, bits 3 and 4 would be set and the corresponding status word would be
`0b00001100` or `0xC0` or `12`.

The bits are assigned as follows:

[horizontal]
Bit 1:: Critical error e.g. hardware failure or checksum failure
Bit 2:: Clock has been adjusted more than the synchronization limit
Bit 3:: All-phase power failure occurred
Bit 4:: Clock invalid
Bit 5:: Current data set cannot be used

{nbsp}
